readability-redundant-inline-specifier.description:
Description

Detects redundant
inline
specifiers on function and variable declarations.

Examples:

constexpr
inline
void
f
()
{}

In the example above the keyword
inline
is redundant since constexpr
functions are implicitly inlined

class
MyClass
{
inline
void
myMethod
()
{}
};

In the example above the keyword
inline
is redundant since member functions
defined entirely inside a class/struct/union definition are implicitly inlined.
readability-redundant-inline-specifier.option:
Static analysis (Clang-Tidy) options are configured via .clang-tidy file.

Options
StrictMode
If set to
true
, the check will also flag functions and variables that
already have internal linkage as redundant. Default is
false
.
